_meta.description: arXiv paper candidates for document structure preservation evaluation
_meta.scope: English-language structure preservation evaluation for PDF parsing pipelines

selection_criteria.domain: cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG (Computational Linguistics, Computer Vision, Machine Learning)
selection_criteria.language: English only (Korean coverage provided by test_1; multilingual by OmniDocBench)
selection_criteria.source_requirement: LaTeX source (.tex) must be publicly available via arXiv e-print

structural_diversity.table-heavy: Papers with >=3 result comparison or benchmark tables (e.g., survey, empirical studies)
structural_diversity.equation-heavy: Papers with >=5 display equations or mathematical derivations (e.g., theoretical work, proofs)
structural_diversity.code-block: Papers with algorithm pseudocode or listing environments
structural_diversity.mixed: Papers combining tables, equations, and figure captions without a single dominant element

exclusion_criteria: Papers without LaTeX source on arXiv (PDF-only uploads)
Papers whose LaTeX source fails pandoc conversion after preprocessing
Papers with <500 characters of converted GT markdown
Papers with excessive custom macros causing >50% content loss in conversion
selection_criteria.sample_size_justification: n>=30 required by Central Limit Theorem for valid parametric statistics (mean, confidence interval) on evaluation metrics. 50 candidates selected to yield >=30 after conversion failures (~78% success rate observed).
